text: Q: What documents are required for college admission? A: Submit the following: 1) Completed application form 2) 10th/12th grade mark sheets 3) Transfer certificate 4) Character certificate 5) Passport-sized photos 6) Government ID proof. International students must additionally provide passport copy and valid student visa documents.
Q: When is the application deadline? A: Main deadline: January 15th. Late applications accepted until January 30th with ₹5,000 late fee. All submissions close at 11:59 PM IST on respective dates.

Q: How does the management quota system work? A: 35% seats allocated through management quota. Selection criteria: 1) Academic merit (minimum 75%) 2) Personal interview 3) Extra-curricular achievements. Fees: 25% higher than regular admissions. Complete details available at www.college.edu/admissions.

Q: What is the policy for students with academic backlogs? A: Maximum 2 backlogs allowed during application review. Candidates with >2 backlogs must submit: 1) Clearance certificate from previous institution 2) Academic improvement plan. Each case reviewed individually by the admissions committee.

Q: What is the detailed fee structure? A: Annual fees (Indian Rupees): 1) Undergraduate: ₹1.5-2.5 lakhs 2) Engineering: ₹2.2 lakhs 3) Medical: ₹3.5 lakhs 4) MBA: ₹2.8 lakhs + Additional charges: ₹25,000 admission fee + ₹15,000 development fee.

Q: What payment methods are accepted? A: Available options: 1) Online: Credit/Debit cards, UPI 2) Demand draft payable to 'ABC College' 3) Bank transfer (NEFT/RTGS). International students: SWIFT transfers or credit cards (3% processing fee applies).

Q: What are the sports quota provisions? A: 5% seats reserved for athletes. Requirements: 1) State/National level certificates 2) Fitness trials 3) Sports achievement portfolio. Benefits include fee waivers up to 30% for exceptional athletes.

Q: What scholarship opportunities exist? A: Available scholarships: 1) Merit-based (50% fee waiver for top 1% rankers) 2) Need-based (family income < ₹5LPA) 3) Women in STEM (30% waiver) 4) Government schemes for SC/ST/OBC students.

Q: Describe the hostel facilities. A: Campus housing features: 1) 3,000+ capacity 2) Room options: Single (₹1.2L/yr), Double (₹90k/yr), Triple (₹75k/yr) 3) Amenities: Wi-Fi, 24/7 security, cafeteria, laundry, recreation rooms.

Q: What are recent placement statistics? A: Placement highlights: 1) 85% placement rate (2023 batch) 2) 300+ recruiting companies 3) Average package: ₹6.5 LPA 4) Highest package: ₹28 LPA (Microsoft) 5) Pre-placement training modules available.
